com.soa.message.header

Interface Headers

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public interface Headers
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    This interface encapsulates the lookup and manipulation of a set of message headers. Header lookup is case-insensitive. As part of the contract for this interface, values added with the same name as an existing header will be combined into a single Header instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeaders

        Header[] getHeaders()
        Get all defined Headers
        Returns:
        The set of currently defined Header instances.

      • getHeader

        Header getHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Lookup a Header by name
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header. Lookup is case-insensitive.
        Returns:
        The specified Header or null if not found. Note that all headers in this collection are merged on entry. This means that headers added with the same name will be combined into this single result with a HeaderPart for each added value.

      • getDateHeader

        Header getDateHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Lookup a Header by name. This method indicates that the field value will be interpreted as a date.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header. Lookup is case-insensitive.
        Returns:
        The specified Header or null if not found. The resulting Header will have its value interpreted as a date.

      • addHeader

        Header addHeader(Header header)
          throws GException
        Add a Header to the collection
        Parameters:
        header - The Header to add
        Returns:
        The resulting Header that is the combination of any previously defined Headers added with the same name, and this header. If there were no existing entries with a corresponding name, the result will be equivalent to the passed in value but may not be the same instance.
        Throws:
        GException

      • addHeader

        Header addHeader(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String value)
          throws GException
        Add a header to the collection. If the name corresponds to any existing header, the new value is added to the current value set.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name
        value - The header value. This may be a complex string that may a value (or not) and any number of parameters.
        Returns:
        The Header instance constructed from this new value, combined with any existing Headers with the same name.
        Throws:
        GException

      • setHeader

        Header setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String value)
          throws GException
        Set the value of a header. This will override any existing Header with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name. Name lookup is case-insensitive
        value - The header value. This may include any parameters, and may be multi-valued with each value separated by a comma.
        Returns:
        The new Header created from the specified name and value
        Throws:
        GException

      • setHeader

        Header setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                 java.util.Date value)
          throws GException
        Set the value of a header. This will override any existing Header with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name. Name lookup is case-insensitive
        value - The header value as a Date.
        Returns:
        The new Header created from the specified name and value encoded using RFC 822 format.
        Throws:
        GException

      • setHeader

        Header setHeader(Header header)
          throws GException
        Set the value of a specific header
        Parameters:
        header - The header
        Throws:
        GException

      • removeHeader

        Header removeHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Remove a specific header
        Parameters:
        name - The header name. Lookup is case-insensitive
        Returns:
        The removed Header instance or null if none found matching the specified name.

      • containsHeader

        boolean containsHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Convenience method to check for the existence of a specific header in this collection.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name. Lookup is case-insensitive
        Returns:
        True to indicate that the collection contains the specified header or false to indicate that it does not.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear the collection
